p: Evaluated against Gram−negative bacteria, which tend to be more resistant to antimicrobial agents than Gram−positive bacteria because of the additional protection afforded by the outer membrane [ 35], all EOs showed moderate activity against P. aeruginosa and E. coli (standard strain) (MICs 500 µg·mL −1), except for C. squalida and S. guianensis, which proved inactive against the latter.
